tags.name: Merchants API
tags.description: Merchants API enables VOP partners to search and onboard Visa defined merchant identifiers for specific merchant or store locations. Visa Merchant ID (VMID) identifies a merchant uniquely and Visa Store ID (VSID) identifies the store location. Before a merchant can be a target for an offer its VMID or VSID must be "onboarded" into partner's VOP community. Partners can choose to create an offer against multiple merchants, for which merchant group APIs should be utilized.

tags.name: Offers API
tags.description: Offers API enables partners to create new offers and notify VOP when a cardholder wants to opt-in an offer. VOP partners will need to work with their assigned Visa Implementation manager to create templates which can be used to create new offers. Cardholders can link specific offers to their user profiles using activation endpoints and de-link using deactivation endpoints. VOP partners can also retrieve the activation details related to an offer or a cardholder using Offers API endpoints.

tags.name: Rewards API
tags.description: Rewards API enables partners to issue a statement credit to a cardholder by submitting a statement credit request to the VOP. Statement credits can only be issued against valid transactions for PANs enrolled in VOP

tags.name: Users API
tags.description: Users API allows partners to enroll participants/Visa card and receive information from their  qualified transaction activity. It also allows cardholders to activate a specific offer while  they perform certain qualifying transactions.

post.description:
API to get users for an enrolled card

Card Details types: PAN, ServiceKey or ServiceRecordId

post.summary: Delete Visa Merchant Identifiers from Merchant Group

parameters.name: communityCode
parameters.description: Client community code, must be exact match with the community code (CL level) provided by Visa. : mandatory

parameters.name: fromDateTime
parameters.description: Start date for the values requested. Unix date/time. For example, 1622651177 represents Wednesday, June 2, 2022 4:26:17 PM : optional

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of records to be returned back in the response. Maximum PageSize is 5000. If left blank, the response defaults to 5000 as well : optional

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: "Start index for the values requested. Default value is 0. For merchant groups with more than 5000 records, use this field to iterate through entire merchant group" : optional

parameters.name: merchantGroupName
parameters.description: Merchant Group name, must be an exact match to existing merchant group name. This field is case sensitive. : optional

post.summary: Add Acquirer Details to Merchant Group
Delete Acquirer Details from Merchant Group

get.summary: Search for Visa Merchant or Store Identifiers

parameters.name: communityCode
parameters.description: Client community code, must be exact match with the community code (CG level) provided by Visa. : mandatory

parameters.name: merchantSearchType
parameters.description: Possible values "Exact' or "Relative". "Exact" value forces all the input criteria to match for search results. When search type value is "Relative", the response includes merchant details where some or all of the input criteria matched : mandatory

parameters.name: merchantId
parameters.description: Visa defined merchant id : optional

parameters.name: merchantName
parameters.description: Conditional. Required when MerchantCountryCode is supplied : optional

parameters.name: storeId
parameters.description: Visa defined store id : optional

parameters.name: merchantUrl
parameters.description: URL of the merchant. : optional

parameters.name: businessRegistrationId
parameters.description: Business Registration ID / Tax ID: optional

parameters.name: cardAcceptorId
parameters.description: The Card Acceptor ID (CAID) is a unique identifier number for the originator of transfers. Typically, an ID is between 1 and 15 characters and is assigned for each store location : optional

parameters.name: acquirerBin
parameters.description: Acquiring Identifier, formerly known as Acquiring BIN. Can be used in combination with Card Acceptor ID to search for specific store location : optional

parameters.name: merchantPhoneNumber
parameters.description: Merchant Phone Number : optional

parameters.name: acquirerBid
parameters.description: Acquirer Business Identification Number (BID). Can be used in combination with Acquirer MID to search for specific store location : optional

parameters.name: acquirerMid
parameters.description: Acquirer Merchant Identification Number (MID) : optional

parameters.name: merchantCountryCode
parameters.description: Merchant Country Code in 3 digit numeric code, for example 840 for US. : optional

parameters.name: merchantCity
parameters.description: City of the merchant : optional

parameters.name: merchantState
parameters.description: State of the merchant : optional

parameters.name: merchantPostalCode
parameters.description: Postal code of the merchant : optional

parameters.name: merchantStreetAddress
parameters.description: Street address of the merchant : optional

parameters.name: returnMatchIndicators
parameters.description: If set to "true", response will include the input attributes that are exact with the merchant entries in the response : optional

This section is optional and can be skipped if the user is being activated at offer and all merchants that are part of merchant group within the offer.

isDeleted.description: True if merchant is active in GMR DB

externalId.description: Merchants within a merchant group can be grouped together with External ID field, defined when merchant is being added to the merchant group. ExternalId is 25-character alphanumeric (all CAPS) field which does not allow any spaces or special characters.

modifiedBy.description: API username for the user who edited the merchant in the merchant group. CYBS if edited through CSC

createdDate.description: Date merchant was added to the merchant group

modifiedDate.description: Date the merchant record was modified/deleted

visaStoreName.description: Normalized name for the store location

merchantCategoryCode.description: Merchant category codes (MCCs) are four-digit numbers that describe a merchant's primary business activities.

endDateInMerchantGroup.description: End date for merchant or store location. This date is used for offer qualification

startDateInMerchantGroup.description: Start date for merchant or store location. This date is used for offer qualification

merchantVerificationValue.description: Merchant Verification Value or MVV refers to a value assigned by Visa used to identify participation in select merchant programs

endIndex.description: Index of last record. Useful for pagination

correlationId.description: This value is generated by the client, and should be unique per request submission. If provided, the correlation id is included in the response, allowing client to unambiguously map requests to responses.

responseDateTime.description: Response Date Time in GMT. Format 2022-01-18T22:29:12.8759678Z

countOfRemainingRecords.description: Count of Remaining records. Useful for pagination

LanguageId.description: The unique identifier used to describe what language the user speaks. For example, "en-US."

TimeZoneId.description: User's preferred timeZone. Format 'Pacific Standard Time'

communityCode.description: Community Code

transactionAmount.description: Transaction Amount. Must be exact match with the transaction being searched

countryCode.description: The mobile country code for the user. Sample value '1' for United States

isContactVerified.description: Denotes if the contact information has been verified.  Specifically, the user has responded to a message sent via the contact channel.

authCode.description:
6 AN
Acceptable characters are AZ in uppercase, 09, and spaces. The field should not contain
all zeros or all spaces; however, acquirers must be able to receive all zeros or all blanks.
No special characters are allowed.
